name: Inn at the Market

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many reasons for going to Seattle, but if a visit to the Public Market is one of yours, I can't think of a better place to stay than the Inn at the Market. Our extremely comfortable room was not cheap but represented good value -- large and airy with an expansive water view. Service was excellent, including a wide choice of daily newspapers and good restaurant advice from the front desk (try the Steelhead Diner around the corner). Our bags were delivered to the room by a young man named Brett, who was so friendly and informative that he set the tone for the entire stay. For the most spectacular selection of flowers, you will want to get to the market early; if it rains, the art museum is nearby and the aquarium only a short walk away (albeit one involving many stairs). Note: While the market has some interesting craft booths, this is not a neighborhood for upscale shopping.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a lively location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Our day was perfect, and due to an unexpected family friend at your hotel named Wade we arrived to a fabulous room with a huge deck overlooking the market with a full water view unlike another found in Seattle. We would recomend this hotel to everyone who is looking for the best! Great location, best Seattle view, excellent service and thoughtfulness. Also, the bed is so comfy, my husband wants me to find out where we can buy one!
reviews.title: The mist wonderful hotel for our wedding night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time visiting Seattle and I couldn't have been happier with our choice. The location is unbeatable. Steps away from the Market, with some of the best food options located around the hotel. The rooms were excellent, roomy, and the tempurpedic beds had me sleeping like a rock. I thought that the only improvement would be to add their own kitchen so they don't have to rely on the neighboring restaurants for room service. But that was so minor. I also loved the terrace, that was accessible to all guest so they could relax morning or night and watch the harbor and the ships coming in to the market.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from 5 days at the Inn at the Market. From the first moments of checking in when I was asked if I'd prefer a Seattle Times or a New York Times in the morning until the last moments of the bellman carefully packing my rental car, I enjoyed the supreme customer service of this lovely hotel. Our room was beautiful with a great view of the ferries crossing the Sound. Because we were literally only steps from the Pike Street Market, I visited daily, bought fresh flowers and fruit and did some great people watching.The Cafe Campagne associated with the hotel served the best French bistro food we have had anywhere. Steelhead Cafe across the street was also fine, as was Place Pigalle. And all these great restaurants were less than a 2 minute walk! The little patio at the entrance to the hotel contained two lovely shops where I did all my Mother's Day shopping in spite of great other shopping also walking distance away.
reviews.title: A Perfect Blend of Setting and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the bed? Divine. Room service? Fast and delicious. Overall ambiance? About the best US hotel we have found in many years..
reviews.title: Get what you pay for plus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night. Just a few feet away from Pike Place Market, the location cannot be beat. The rooms were nicely done and the internet was complementary. The staff was friendly and helpful. Good breakfast places around. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is definitely this place's main asset. Rooms are nicely done but not flashy. There is a roof top deck for those without a room with a view.
reviews.title: Very nice accomadation at Pikes Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Internet is reasonably quick and free. Bed is comfortable. Breakfast is not included. There are several restaurants in the building but are not directly accessible from the lobby.
reviews.title: Great stay in the heart of Seattle!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I only got to stay one night at Inn at the Market (business), but they made sure I had a wonderful stay! I was allowed early check in, and then the friendly concierge gave me a map to show me how to see the Seattle highlights, like the Space Needle and Chihuly Museum. I was also shown how to navigate the super-cool-and-larger-than-it-looks Pike's Place Market, which is literally steps from the inn. The room itself is clean, comfortable and spacious, with robe and umbrella (a must in Seattle) in the room. There is also coffee service, and the bed and sheets are soft.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day, I ordered room service for breakfast, and it arrived very promptly. When I asked for ketchup, the bellhop produced it from his pocket!
reviews.title: THE BASE n THE CITY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews of Inn at the Market, I'm having a difficult time adding to the accolades. We were there for six nights and thoroughly enjoyed every minute. Our room was beautiful (fantastic bed linens) with a breathtaking view of the water. We were in room 804, and the picture on the website of the water view room is entirely accurate. There was even a complementary bottle of wine waiting for us when we arrived. The service at the hotel is also wonderful. I had to buy flowers at the market (couldn't resist), and the hotel provided a vase. Also the hair dryer was not working properly, but within a couple of hours of letting the desk know, a new dryer was installed.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As everyone has said, the location is perfect--many lovely restaurants, wine bars, shops, as well as the Market are at your fingertips. When we returned home, we watched "Sleepless in Seattle," which we hadn't seen for many years. We were delighted to see views of the market, the Athenian where Tom Hanks ate with his friend, and--to make it even better--we saw the Inn at the Market! It made us wish we were still there.
reviews.title: Ideal location and beautiful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location to do many things, able to walk to Argosys Harbor Tour and Aquarium, walked to Monorail to go to Music Experience, Pacific Science center and Space Needle. Walk outside and there is Pike Place Market, a 2 minute walk to the first Starbucks. Friendly Staff and knowledgable,cozy room and wonderful bed. Just a great place to stay. A++++++
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at 'The Inn at the Market last week for a short get away. We were really impressed by everything at this hotel. The location was great. It was just up the hill from the Pike Market and many little shops and restaurants in the area. The service was impecable. Everyone at the Inn was so friendly and helpful. All you had to do was ask and they went out of their way to help you. We asked for a taxi a couple of times and the front desk made their town car available to us. The room itself was beautiful.
reviews.title: Very pleasant, very relaxed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a water front suite with a wonderful view.....and the beds were very comforable. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Would recommend this hotel very highly !!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I thought this an attractive little hotel. Rooms were on the small side, but nicely furnished. The rooftop garden deck was a nice photo-op, but too breezy in Sept. for lounging. Also, getting service for a glass of wine was a major undertaking. We finally had to go to the bar next door, order it, then come back and wait for the bellboy to deliver it. Didn't need a hassle after a long flight! Would probably stay elsewhere next time. Perhaps the Fairmont.
reviews.title: Not impressed by the Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The valet parking is helpful, but as you can expect downtown, it was pricey($24/night, i think). The lobby is modest but comfortable - you'll note that there are no pictures of the lobby on the website, because it's not much of a selling point. The courtyard, however, was quaint and quite pleasant. The fountain is relaxing, and the brick facade with the hanging ivy is a beautiful entry.
reviews.title: Nice botique hotel, awesome location, big room

likes.liked: — Location - in the middle of everything
likes.disliked: — Few rooms have a Bay view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had a courtyard view room at the 4th floor, which has no view of Elliot Bay. I think you need to be at the 6th or higher for a bay view. The room was enormous and comfortable, and the bathroom is spacious. The ceilings were high, as expected of an older building. The bed was a king size Tempurpedic, as advertised. If you've never slept in a Tempurpedic, I must say that it is similar to an Asian hotel experience - the bed seems very hard at first, but gradually (slowly) forms to your shape, for a rested sleep - it just doesn't seem like it at first!
reviews.title: Wish I were still here!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant, Campagne, is an excellent (though smallish) French style restaurant, with a good wine selection, particularly the dessert wines (if there's any remaining, try the Cuvee Boytrytis-amazing!). Room service is offered from here, and I can only assume the experience will be as nice. There is a small coffee shop with morning bakery, and that was a delight first thing in the morning. The morning paper was at the door, and although the offerings included the New York Times and Wall Street Journal, I opted for the local paper. In-room wireless internet was complimentary, and signal strength in the room was fine.
reviews.title: Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else

likes.disliked: — alchohol isn't included in the minibar - but that seems to be common throughout the US

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is simply wonderful, literally across the street from Post Alley and well-known pub Kell's, and (in my opinion) a better, local favorite White Horse Pub - DO stop in and give this gem a try! As you can see from the pictures, the Public Market is at your doorstep, and the rooftop terrace has a spectacular view (lacking in most of the rooms). I wish I had a full day to appreciate the rooftop deck, because it was delightful first thing in the morning (again, I refer to the pictures). The energy in the area is wonderful, and you are walking distance to much that Seattle offers. Again, the Market, the hill climb, the Aquarium, Ivar's (a must for Seattle), are all a few minutes of downhill stroll (long enough to enjoy a latte on the way!)
reviews.title: The best hotel ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My work keeps me away from home, so usually the last thing I want to do is travel on MY free time. But the opportunity to come up to Seattle for a romantic getaway was too good to resist. Friends had told me about the Inn at the Market (I had never stayed there on biz), so my wife and I booked a room. What a great decision. Every part of our stay was terrific. The hotel is right in the heart of the Pike Place Market, and our room overlooked the water. Everything was perfect, and we had an enjoyable weekend touring the city and the Market. We enjoyed a bottle of wine on the rooftop deck and watched a spectacular sunset on Saturday. No question about it -- we'll be back.
reviews.title: What a weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the inn at the market on 9/18/08.we were leaving on a 65 day cruise and arrived a day earlier.it was only by chance that we chose this hotel.well talk about our trip starting out on the best foot possible this was that start.1)location is the best,2)rooms excellent,3)staff was always very accomodating and helpful and would go out of their way to solve or answer any questions regarding ,restaurants,shopping,walking to shops in area,etc.they were as good if not better than any tour or travel service.i asked to speak w/the manager david watkins upon leaving as i wanted him to know our stay was simply the best.if anyone has any questions regarding this hotel,feel free to ask us.if you do choose this facility please tell mr.watkins marv and sheila from st louis send their best.
reviews.title: look no further

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Seattle and a wonderful four day stay at the Inn at the Market. The hotel was recommended by a friend and we couldn't have been more pleased.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location

likes.liked: — Location and overall room decor & comfort.
likes.disliked: — TV channel line-up (primarily local gov't access & news stations)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well-maintained and very modern, but not stuffy. We had a lovely partial water view room - comfortable queen bed, small bay window with table and chairs, sofa, excellent armoire and closet storage, mini-bar with enough room to hold drinks, etc. we purchased elsewhere, and a large writing desk. The bathroom was modern yet warmly decorated. If there is one thing we could change, it would be to upgrade the TV channel selection. While it's true that you don't go on vacation to watch TV, it would have been nice to have entertaining television to watch a little before falling asleep and when we wanted to just relax and enjoy the room.
reviews.title: Yet Another Happy Customer

likes.liked: — Loved the intimate feel of the hotel.
likes.disliked: — Didn't care for the cloth shower curtains -clings too much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Anything we asked for was taken care of with a smile, from making reservations for a tour of the Boeing plant (highly recommended, by the way) to printing out our boarding passes the night before we left.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel in a great location. The room was a good size and not too noisy even though it was on the town side. We enjoyed sitting on the terrace with a glass of wine. Just one point make sure that you check out in person. We did an express check out and then when we got our credit card bill found that they had charged us even though we had prepaid through Expedia. This was promptly sorted out but was inconvenient
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and myself recently spent 5 nights at the Inn at the Market while I attended a convention. We had a very nice time at this small, comfortably furnished hotel that has a great location just up the hill from Pike Place Market. The walk to the convention center is about 8 blocks east, pretty easy except for the steep 1/2 block adjacent to the hotel. There are a number of trendy restaurants as you walk north on First Ave. and Pioneer Square with its old stone buildings and charming pergola is south along the same road. And of course, the market is a 1/2 block to the west and has many food stands, boutiques, fish and flower stalls, handicrafts, jewelry tables, entertainers, and ethnic dining options that spill onto the narrow alleys and covered arcades. It was a pleasure to wake up in the morning and grab something to eat nearby while watching the small trucks and vans unload their wares and the vendors set up their tables.
reviews.title: Boutique Charmer in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the corner overlooking the city and was very spacious, with lots of storage space in the wardrobe and a large bathroom. The sink was a pedestal-type, so spreading out toiletries was limited to the glass shelf or nearby small table/shelf unit. We could hear traffic noise from the street, which was annoying, but we did request their lowest-priced room and it is in the city, so I wasn't expecting total silence when we closed the doors. The rooms have window seats with pillows, a nice feature that makes the rooms appear bigger and provides additional seating or a good spot for reading while people-watching. The decor is contemporary, with beiges, browns, and blacks predominating. In good weather, the upstairs terrace would be a nice place to sit and enjoy the views of the bay and the market.
reviews.title: Great views from terrace but only a brick wall from our window....

likes.liked: — Comfy bed, lovely views from terrace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The modern, brick building surrounds a pleasant courtyard with a splashing fountain/sculpture adjacent to some outdoor seating for the hotel restaurant. The lobby opens off the courtyard and has a fireplace, stuffed chairs, and the registration desk, where the helpful staff operates.
reviews.title: Exemplary Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our time here. The hotel is a nice option for those who don't want a large convention hotel in a central Seattle location. Do be aware that Seattle does have its share of street people and that there are a couple of strip clubs near the front of Pike Place Market.
reviews.title: Perfectly Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to almost everything! I walked everywhere!. It's just a few blocks to Nordstroms, Art Museum, ferries and more. It was fun to walk out the door and be at the market too. We loved the deck, the room was nice and clean and the bed was the best! The chocolates on the turndown were so good! We would definately stay here again. Also we had a wonderful meal at Le Campagne and the waiter was the best.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: After a lunatic 20000+ miles of flying in the space of a few days, I had a night to kill in Seattle before an early trans-con flight back to NYC. Couldnt last out all night as was the original plan, so needed a hotel, and had none prebooked.
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: This place was recommended to me , and was just a block or so from the excellent irish pub (kells) I just happened to have ended up in.
reviews.title: inn at the market-ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just one room left, at $220 inc tax.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent friendly staff, lovely decor, big rooms (im used to NYC so a rabbit hutch will seem big , but these were indeed spacious).
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for only one night for a quick business trip to Seattle. The staff was extremely helpful and professional. Room was very comfortable with a courtyard view. Proximity to the market and good restaurants was perfect. Wish I had more time. This was my first trip to Seattle and I am considering a short weekend trip back. I would definitely stay at the Inn at the Market again. It was perfect.
reviews.title: Short Business Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was dubious about booking a room in the heart of Seattle's best known tourist attraction but my concern was allayed immediately with the warm (literally, with a roaring fire in the lobby) friendly check-in. We had booked a suite to give our teenage daughter some privacy and felt that we got good value for the money. The view of the Market and Puget Sound was easy to enjoy from the comfort of the living room. The rooms amenities were plentiful from the high thread count bed linens to the Gilchrist and Soames toiletries in the bathroom. The hotel's prime location meant access to many good restaurants and shops. We enjoyed a drink at the adjacent wine bar, Marché, and a visit to the original Sur laTable right next door. After one visit, I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Seattle.
reviews.title: Pike Place Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This time I was only in Seattle for one night, but the concierge remembered us from a year ago! This hotel is perfectly located beside the Pike Street Market and all the little alley ways. The view is magnificent, and the roof top deck is a wonderful place in warmer weather. Everything about the Inn is first class.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel as an extension of a vacation cruise as I've never been to Seattle and wanted to explore the city for a few days. The weather was perfect and I acutally had the huge sliding glass windows in the room open most all of the time. The rooftop sundeck is huge and a great place to relax and enjoy the views. Pikes Market is literally steps away and awesomely convenient.....the shuttle to the civic center is within walking distance as well. There is also a tastey French restaurant next door.
reviews.title: Great weekend hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came here to go the the 'FISH" birthplace in the market. We had an expensive room but were further upgraded free. Great service, wonderful two room upstairs, downstairs apartment with views into the market and out into the harbour across the deck. Good fridge space for those market purchases.
reviews.title: Best hotel of the trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great boutique hotel. It is not the typical huge, rubber stamp type facility. We loved this hotel. The bell men and front desk staff were great. They went out of their way to make sure our stay was great. We were there for our 25th anniversary. We arrived and found two chocolate strawberries situated on our already turned down bed. A large bucket of ice was ready for champagne. The bed was very comfy and we were delighted to find it was a Temperpedic (memory foam) bed, which is what we have at home. We spent two nights at the Inn at the Market before a cruise to Alaska and one night upon our return. Literally every staff member made sure to mention that all staff were trained to help with conceirge duties and they were all very helpful to help us find our way around, providing maps and bus information. We ate breakfast across the street in the market, where you are really hardpressed to not find a large variety of food. The other morning we had pastry and coffee in a french pastry shop just down the street. We picked up great fruit to snack on in our room. We ate at Etta's one night and had delicious fresh oysters, halibut and fabulous coconut creme pie for dessert. One night we selected a variety of cheeses, crab, bread, olives, berries, peaches and things from various shops in the market. We bought some wine from Cost Plus, just down the street and had a little picnic up on the 5th floor deck. It was great! Gosh, we just had a great time and the situation of the hotel made it perfect for a nap before dinner and stopping back in to drop off packages. We were greeted each time we came and left by the very friendly staff. The staff called for cabs for us when we needed to get to far away destinations. They were wonderful!! So, a nice clean room, comfy bed, great bathroom, perfect location, great garden deck to watch the bustling crowd below. They have coffee/tea in the lobby....as much as a person could possibly want! I scampered down in my bathrobe once and nobody seemed to care.....just like most boutique hotels, you sort of feel at home. So...if you are looking for convenience, great staff, nice hotel...not cookie cutter...this is the place. I am surprised to read some of the less than favorable reviews. Perhaps these will make it easier for folks like me to get reservations. I spoke with a number of people up on the 5th floor deck who always stay at the Inn and know that a reservation well in advance is necessary. It seemed the saavy travelers enjoyed this facility. The others may be more comfortable in one of the corporate high rises. But for us.....we will be at the Inn and tell our family to also stay here.
reviews.title: location, location, location

likes.liked: — The location in the area of the Public Market. Everything an easy walk.,
likes.disliked: — We loved it...it was just perfect for us...no complaints!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Inn at the Market over a long Labor Day weekend. I've read a lot of mixed reviews on the Inn and all I can say is we had a really nice experience there.
reviews.title: We had a very nice experience at the Inn at the Market!

likes.liked: — Very nice in a good location for touristy stuff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're not big on paying a lot for a view in any hotel room because we just don't spend that much time in our room so we opted for a city view. We were in room 408 and it has a view of the courtyard that you walk through as you enter the hotel. For a view of the water, we were very satisfied with simply going up to the 5th floor deck where you had an unlimited view of Elliot Bay, Mt. Rainier, the waterfront and everything you'd see if you had a water view room. We took so many pictures from the deck and just stood there and admired the view. It was a nice place to strike up a conversation with other guests and overall, a nice place to escape the hustle of the Market area below.
reviews.title: Big Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was lovely and spacious and we saw no signs of any of the wear and tear that some reviews have mentioned. The bathroom in our room was the size of a small bedroom! And one thing I really loved about the bathroom was the shelving unit available for us to put our bathroom things on. Every hotel should offer this so that you don't have to live completely out of your suitcase or have a thousand things on the back of the toilet simply for them to be handy.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tempurpedic bed got a mixed review. I had no issues with it and found it quite comfortable. My husband...not so much. He would have liked a firmer mattress and he said he felt as if he was sleeping on his head the entire time. Overall though, it was fine.
reviews.title: Inn Okay, Not Memorable

likes.disliked: — Just didn't feel that we got what we expected at that price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had but one night in Seattle on a tour of the pacific northwest and we wanted to be able to have a great view and experience downtown Seattle. What a great choice we made with the Inn at the Market. We were upgraded to a full water view, which was fabulous! The room was not huge, but the view made up for that, and everything about the hotel was first-rate, from check-in to check-out. The rooftop garden was incredible--even at the beginning of October, we were able to sit out for both breakfast and cocktail hour, enjoying the view and the weather. Being right next to the Pike Market was terrific--we enjoyed the shopping and eating. This is a great hotel and the perfect spot to experience Seattle!
reviews.title: location, ambiance, luxury--what more could you want?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Inn at the Market is a wonderful place to stay in Seattle. The expense is a bit more then I usually spend but it was worth it because the hotel is located right next to Pike's Place Market. The view can't be beat in all Seattle. There's a wonderful balcony to watch a romantic sunset. When checking in at the hotel my husband and I were pleasantly surprised to receive a room upgrade to a suite. Since we were celebrating our anniversary it made the stay that much more special. I only wish we were able to stay a little longer then planned. The bed was very comfortable due to the quality of the mattress. I wanted to take it home with me. The front desk staff were very helpful in making a dinner recommendation and reservation for us. Again we were surprised when we were greeted at the restaurant (Cutter's) with ribbon decorations and a candle on the table. The hotel treated us to an appetizer also. We felt like VIPs. I recommend the Inn at the Market for a romantic getaway in an exciting city.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently we celebrated our 38th wedding anniversary at Inn At The Market. We stayed two nights on our first visit and then returned for one night the following week after visiting British Columbia. Both stays at IATM were delightful and exceeded our expectations in every way. Our accommodations were beautiful and the location of the Inn is excellent for exploring the city. The terrace on the fifth floor is perfect for relaxing during the day or evening. From the moment we booked our reservations we could not have asked for a more professional, friendly, or helpful staff. Everyone on the IATM team went out of their way to insure that our time with them was indeed special. We are especially grateful to Mr. Watkins and Ms. Cervantes for their kindness and thoughtfulness. Our sincere thanks to all for helping make our 38th anniversary celebration a most memorable occasion. The IATM will always be our choice in Seattle!
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel

likes.liked: — An excellent boutique hotel with lovely rooms and public areas and an exceptional staff

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: What a great hotel and the best position with views over the harbour. Each afternoon spent watching the sun go down over the water enjoying a drink on the roof top area. Very close to the makets and city shopping area. Staff were only too heapful to assist with directions.Some rooms dont have views so the higher the better facing the harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed a hotel for just one night, prior to departing on a cruise. This hotel was perfect for us. Great location, just steps from the Market. We enjoyed walking around the area.
reviews.title: Perfect location; great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just arrived home from our trip to Seattle. We had a wonderful time at this hotel. We had reserved a partial water view room and were pleasantly surprised when they upgraded us to a 7th floor townhome suite with a dramatic panoramic view of Elliott Bay. Absolutely spectacular !
reviews.title: Fantastic !
Great location and patio
reviews.text: We didn't touch our car for 3 days. Everything was close, and we also took advantage of the free bus line that stops at the end of the block.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate breakfast at Baccos (next door) where the staff was very friendly. I can't think of one thing I didn't like about this hotel !
reviews.title: Excellent location for Pike Place Market

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in October and got lucky with the weather. It was sunny for most of my stay. As a result, I was able to take advantage of the fifth floor terrace overlooking the bay. I loved this feature of the hotel.
reviews.title: Everything I hoped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located across the street from the Pike Place Market so it's ideal for tourists. The downtown business district is an easy 5 or 6 block walk. The Inn is a smaller hotel that has been well maintained but shows its age a bit. All staff that I encountered were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is well suited for both business travellers and leisure travellers, including families.
reviews.title: A Stay We Will Long Remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in room 702 for three nights. This is an end room that takes top two levels of hotel. Very large, two-floor suite with floor-to-ceiling windows on each floor. Incredible king-sized bed. More space than we needed for two. Staff was very helpful and kind. Had room service all three days - it was good and fairly fast. Free NY Times in lobby was a great bonus. Easy to walk to everything downtown and there's public transport nearby.
reviews.title: Very good - small touches would make it exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all very good. There are some small touches that would vault the accommodations to amazing:
reviews.title: The perfect combination of location, service, and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom needs some TLC. Cabinetry was unfinished on one end of vanity. The grout in shower needs to be updated. There are several scuff marks on the wallpaper in bathroom. Shower curtain was super cheap and torn. One of the tables in the room had a large hole in it
reviews.title: Cozy in Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I met up with my family here last summer on my first trip to Seattle. They generally sleep in whereas I am ready to get out and about on my vacation. This location was right up the street from the market, which was amazing and so much fun. I also found the gum wall and did some amazing shopping on the nearby streets. It was convenient to some fantastic places to eat as well. The staff were all awesome. My room was beautiful and comfortable. I had a window seat with a view of the people coming and going to the market. When I go back to Seattle, I will be saving my money to stay at Inn on the Market.
reviews.title: Spent a night in Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently traveled to Seattle on the way to Fairbanks and discovered this Jewell. We had been to Seattle several times and stayed at other chain hotels. The Inn is within walking distance of everything you need, restaurants, waterfront, attractions, acquarium, Ferris wheel, etc. The location is very discreet and private. The rooms are spacious, clean and well appointed and the rates are decent.. We felt at home. Will definitely visit this Hotel again.
reviews.title: Great location but just average on everything else
Great place, perfect location
reviews.text: We had a brief anniversary trip to Seattle recently and stayed with the Inn. We are so thrilled we did. Location is super. Decided we could easily spend a week eating and exploring in Pike's Place Market and there cannot be a better base for exploration than the Inn. The Inn offered us top notch service, views which were simply to die for and really nice rooms- we had a partial water view with stunning views. Small table and chairs were perfect for looking out at the bay while we enjoyed our complementary champagne and treat provided for our anniversary (thank you for that, my long traveling husband was overwhelmed!). Also, the bed was so comfortable. Between that, the kind and attentive staff and the views it was hard to leave to see the town- but that would be criminal as Seattle is one of the most beautiful, friendly and diverse towns we have visited. Highly recommend, service at its finest!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The most central hotel with nicely appointed rooms. Service was good. Rooftop deck is worth the stay.
reviews.title: Amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed one night prior to returning home after a business trip. Centrally located near Pike's Place with an easy walk to restaurants (94 Stewart), shops, etc. Check in was easy and staff was friendly and helpful. I had a "courtyard" view instead of a water view. I had not requested a specific view, so I'm not complaining. (I learned that if you want a water view you need to book in advance and call to confirm.) Room and bathroom were large, well lit, with good amenities. Bed was devine and I slept soundly for seven hours without waking up -- usual for me when I'm on the road. No extraneous noise -- a suprise because I later discovered there was a family with a small child next door, but I never heard them. I did not use the business center. Wi-Fi in the room was quick, even with downloading files. Although I did not use room service, I did get juice from Baccos. Baccos made a fabulous apple, carrot, grapefruit juice...squeezed while I waited. I plan to return with my spouse for a special weekend.
reviews.title: Great night's sleep and best morning juice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here while at a conference and I brought my wife and child along with me. It was a truly exotic place to stay... to walk out the door and be in the hustle and bustle of fabulous Pike Place Market... who could ask for more? Oh but there is! All around us were fabulous restaurants and shopping that made my wife giddy. Anyway, I wish we could afford to stay there more often - it was quite an experience.
reviews.title: What a Location and an Incredible View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: My husband and I just had a wonderful 5 nights stay at the inn at the market when we were in Seattle. We will not stay anywhere else ever in Seattle. For the location, the atmosphere and the service I can frankly say it can't be beat. I wake up each morning and open the curtains and see the mountains and the market vendors loading their stores and smile. The service is also very good. We went to pioneer square, bainbridge island with a wonderful ferry ride, Fremont, Ballard and university village. It's so welcoming that I cancelled the Alexis to stay here 2 wks later when we take our flight back home. That tells a lot. 
reviews.title: Top notch hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The front desk told us they had arranged a room at the Alexis Hotel and the cost would be charged back to them, and they even paid our cab fare to get there.
reviews.title: Pike Market next door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were also told we could have a free night at the Inn at the Market next time we were in town.
reviews.title: Good, but not as nice as it used to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That's REAL customer service!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Inn at the Market. Everything was great. I have stayed at all of the top hotels in Seattle and would highly recommend this one. The location, attention to detail, the size of the room, the amenities and staff all added to a making this an unforgettable experience!
reviews.title: What a wonderful property you must experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Inn for two nights in May 2011. We had booked a double room with water view and were pleased to be upgraded to a deluxe double with a huge patio shared with only one other room. The room and patio overlook the market and waterfront and it was wonderful just to sit and watch the ferries and people going by. The room was big and well appointed with a small kitchenette area. Our only slight disappointment was that there is no bar in the hotel so while there is a lovely 5th floor patio for all guests overlooking the waterfront, there is no bar to order a drink. You either bring your own or use the mini-bar. Apparently, this will be rectified once the restaurant, Campagne, is renovated, but it would make sense if they were to put a bar in the 5th floor where the seating is. Perhaps for the future. Otherwise, a brilliant stay!
reviews.title: Breathtaking views and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room and the location of the hotel is unbeatable, just try it
reviews.title: Excellent and just great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a most enjoyable Seattle extended weekend. Acting on a recommendation from a friend, we booked our stay at the Inn at the Market (IATM). The name couldn't be more appropriate as it is literally steps to Pike Place Market.
reviews.title: Location! Location! Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: IATM now became home base for the next four days of sight seeing, economy stimulating, and drinking coffee. The staff was professional and courteous throughout or stay. We found the Inn to be comfortable and enjoyed the view from the deck on that rare Seattle warm spring day.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: This was my fifth or sixth visit to the Inn at the Market. The property is better than most: the lobby is handsome, the rooms comfortable (though a little tired and ready for renovation, especially in the case of the bathrooms), the sun deck overlooking the harbor is a treat, and the staff is welcoming. The related restaurants, including not only Campagne but the related bistro in the basement and the lively breakfast place located separately within the same building, are really good. But the whole ballgame here is the location. The views, if you are fortunate enough to have a water-view room, are simply stunning -- not only because of the comings and goings of ferry boats, freighters, liners, Coast Guard cutters, fishing boats, and pleasure craft, but also because of the astonishing mountain range visible across Elliott Bay, which catches the sunset in truly glorious ways. It is also a pleasure to be able to walk half a block down the steep hill to the Pike Place Market, with all its produce and its bustle of activity. There are countless restaurants and clubs within walking distance. As gentrification neuters most of downtown Seattle, this area remains edgy, even a little challenging if you go in certain directions at certain times. The area is not for you if you are uncomfortable with street people and occasional strong smells. It is also a little inconvenient for business; and the business services in the hotel are not comparable to those in a Hyatt or a Marriott. But the tradeoff is a real sense of place, something you can't get in other cities or in Seattle's uptown hotels.
reviews.title: Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: This hotel is in a terrific location half a block from the Pike Place Market and
reviews.title: Expensive but great spot
pleasant
reviews.text: within walking distance of most downtown attractions. It's located on a steep hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (see photos) with a courtyard and ocean view patio. Our room faced the patio and
reviews.title: A view with a room.

likes.liked: — The decor, the beds, and the unreal views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: ocean - great for sunsets. The bed was memory foam so my pregnant wife loved it and
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel!!
Inn at the Market
reviews.text: We stayed at Inn at the Market for a long weekend and had a delightful experience. The staff was very helpful. We stayed on the 6th floor with a view of the Sound. By the little courtyard entrance was a great place for breakfast, Bacco. Also, two french restaurants, Campagne and Cafe Campagne. The Inn is within walking distance of many fine restaurants. The Market is just a short walk down the hill. It also features a nice patio overlooking the water. We will definitely stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this Hotel for several days. We felt that it was an Awesome place to stay as well as a Great Location! The hotel is right up the street from the Public Market. It makes for easy walking to many of the places in the area where you can eat and also close to the waterfront. The room was nice and the bed (a tempurpedic) was like heaven. I almost hated getting out of it in the mornings!
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.liked: — proximity to various activities and tourist attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: They have a town car and if it is available they will pick you up or take you wherever you might need to go. We used it on the way back to the Amtrak station. I found this out because I had e-mailed them with some questions. I indicated that we were celebrating an Anniversary and the day after we checked in they delivered to us some chocolate covered strawberries, decorated really cute as an Anniversary treat! I thought that was a really nice touch.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay!
Loved the hot apple cider
reviews.text: The Deck on the 5th floor was a nice place to checkout the surrounding area of Seattle. You get a really Great View from the space needle but spending some "down time" on the deck was a nice option for us. We did a lot of walking and really enjoyed our time while we were there. I'd definately stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights while I was attending a conference. It was worth the walk to the conference center to stay at the Inn at the Market - we had an eighth floor room which was exceptionally quiet and comfortable. The location next to the Public Market is unparalled - we loved the easy access to street food and activity. Our experience was totally positive and I would not stay anywhere else in Seattle!
reviews.title: Okay, but not amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this place. They are so friendly & helpful. We arrived early, a couple of hours, and they took the luggage to store until the room was ready. They called that afternoon when it was ready. They were apologetic and left us a bottle of wine in the room. I can't believe how kind when it wasn't their problem that we were early. The rooms are so beautiful and quiet. This is my favorite place to stay in Seattle. They are within walking distance of so many attractions and shopping. You never think about your car. It's a relaxing get away.
reviews.title: Best customer service ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent five nights at the IATM in early March for my birthday. I had originally booked my stay in August of last year and learned just two weeks before that they would be renovating during our trip. I wanted to personally thank Shelley Wooten who contacted me, helped preserve my original trip plans and went out of her way to offer us dining credit to make up for the differences in our package. Here's a breakdown of my stay:
reviews.title: Romantic location for a downtown vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms: Due to the renovations I experienced two different rooms, both with beautiful views (corner water view and a water view townhouse) that were very different. The corner water view suite was beautiful with views of Post Alley and the waterfront. I could easily see the Public Market sign. The bathroom was huge with a nice "seat" that extended back from the tub space so you could lay out the toiletries. The downside to this room is that it was very noisy on a Friday and Saturday night. Noise from the courtyard restaurant and from Post Alley and Stewart, coupled with noisy car alarms went on well after midnight so bring some earplugs and you should be fine. The water view townhouse looked out onto the deck from the first floor and out over the deck on the second. It came equipped with a microwave, fridge, small kitchen sink and dishes and cutlery. The bathroom is located upstairs and has a double sink vanity but was actually smaller than the bathroom in our water view suite. It was extremely quiet Sun-Wed and overlooked Pine and the inner courtyard. The towels were nice and soft and the Gilchrist and Soames amenities were a nice touch. All in all I thoroughly enjoyed the rooms and would only ask for two improvements: 1) less minibar items in the fridge so we could chill our water or store some fruit 2) consider a curving shower curtain bar as the bathtub is narrow and the curtains tend to billow even though they are weighted.
reviews.title: location ,location, location ...& view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff: The staff was exceptional. Alyssa checked us in and was warm and welcoming. On all the subsequent days the desk staff helped with all our questions, were very prompt with our car from the valet, handled our room move without a hitch and helped us book an in-room massage that fit our busy schedule. I would highly recommend your schedule one; the IATM provides robes in the rooms so you are all set!
reviews.title: Wonderful getaway for an anniversary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Restaurants: IATM has many dining options right in the courtyard. Room service from Cafe Champagne was good, try their chevre on crostini. Breakfast at Bacco's was delicious. I enjoyed their quiche, their eggs benedict and their brioche french toast. I enjoyed our evening meal at Marche with small plates like mushroom fougasse and a poached pear dessert. Also although Chan is not on the room service menu, you can call in an order and walk right downstairs to pick it up and take it back to your room.
reviews.title: Great location and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were excited about staying at the Inn at the Market, due to the great reviews. Our room was a standard one, with a somewhat disappointing view of the wall of the building across the courtyard, on the 3rd floor. Not a big deal, since we could go up to the rooftop terrace if we wanted a great view.
reviews.title: Had some drawbacks...

likes.disliked: — Comfort of bed, lack of service at front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will say the best thing about the Inn was the location. Pike Place Market is a great place to leisurely explore, and it's right there. My husband walked down across the street every morning to get fresh hot croissants and coffee for breakfast, and we visited the bakeries many times for late night snacks.
reviews.title: Great view and location but rooms lack personality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My biggest complaint was the Tempurpedic mattress. Everyone else in these reviews rave about them, but my back hated it! I have chronic low back pain anyway (and was 6 months pregnant when we went), and was really looking forward to some great sleep, but wound up hurting terribly. In fact, I wound up having to sleep sitting up in bed because laying down was so painful. On our 3rd day there I asked the person at the front desk if I could get a cot in my room because the bed was really uncomfortable to me and they told me it was against fire code. I don't know if that's the truth or not, but it sure wasn't what I wanted to hear. They didn't seem to care too much that a pregnant patron wasn't able to sleep at all on their beds.
reviews.title: We Love the Inn at the Market

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Smaller complaints: my husband and I stopped at the front desk to ask directions from Discovery Park over to the zoo, two of the places we were planning on visiting. The girl handed us a Budget rental car map and circled each place on there for us. She didn't try to help us out with the best route to take from one to the next, even though we asked, just pointed out each place again as if to brush us off. Obviously we can read a map and did find our way, but I was once again disappointed in the service.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the room was very noisy due to all the street noise, especially in the morning as trucks unloaded their stuff for the day at the market. It didn't bother us too badly, because we sleep with a white noise machine which helps to mask it. I can't imagine the racket we would have had to listen to without it. So be aware of that potential problem.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here overnight for business and will come here again everytime I come to seattle. The lobby is very nice and modern. Service was prompt and courteous. The room was well decorated and clean. I liked the bathrobes and the chocolates waiting for me when I checked in. The best thing about this hotel though is the location. You are one block way from the market and great shopping. Even on a Wednesday morning it was bustling and teaming with life.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Inn at the Market is a wonderful place to stay. We had a view of Elliott Bay which we so enjoyed!
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located close to most of the main Seattle attractions - within walking distance.
reviews.title: Loved the Inn at the Market

likes.disliked: — price- did not honor AARP in August

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful - they assisted at ever turn.
reviews.title: Loved the inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again!
reviews.title: Best hotel in Seattle
Perfect location at a fair price
reviews.text: A 2-night stay in early August 2007 was splendid. Only steps away from Pike Place Market, the Inn at the Market is a very fine boutique hotel at a fair price! The roof deck was a great place to have breakfast bought at the Market and to enjoy a cocktail as the sun set. The room was large and tastefully decorated and the bath was roomy and well equipped. The staff was helpful and offered suggestions for a late dinner when we checked in after 9:30 p.m. We are two NJ teachers who would rather spend money on what we see and eat than where we sleep, but do demand a clean and comfortable hotel. Though we spent a bit more than we normally would, we think it was worth it at the end of our 3-week trip to Alaska and the Pacific northwest. Within walking distance of many restaurants and tourist sites, we recommend this hotel for nicer-than-tourist class stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, we payed $300 a night but we knew that going in and the hotel exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: I loved this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived early, around 11 am, and went into the Inn to store our luggage. We were told our room was ready so we were able to check in right then, wonderful news! The room and bathroom were large and the bed was extremely comfortable. Everything was tastefully appointed. Service was always immediate and professional.
reviews.title: great location

likes.liked: — the location and the rooftop area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Seattle and the location was outstanding! Pike Place Market was fabulous; a perfect blend of tourists and locals. We used the fifth floor deck every day. We really, really enjoyed our stay at Inn at the Market and would stay again.
reviews.title: Location, views and lively spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this hotel recently and loved it!! It IS expensive but we had one of the rooms with two doubles and had plenty of room for myself, my husband, and two teenage girls. The views are spectacular and the service is excellent. The rooftop is perfect for anytime of day. I went up early to read or late in the evening to relax. We could not get enough of the view and were within easy walking range of many sites and restaurants. I walked no more thatn two blocks in any direction in the mornings to sample different coffee shops.
reviews.title: expensive for what you get. not for biz travellers.

aka: Inn At The Market Hotel Seattle
description: Inn at the Market is the only downtown Seattle hotel located directly in the famous Pike Place Market. Inn at the Market's ivy-covered courtyard is a tranquil hideaway, just steps away from the vibrant atmosphere of Pike Place Market and the Seattle waterfront. Inn at the Market offers Pacific Northwest style and comfort surrounded by downtown Seattle's most acclaimed restaurants and iconic landmarks.
